meanings.definition: To bend low with the limbs close to the body.
meanings.sent1: I crouch to pick up the fallen toy.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to crouch before pouncing on its prey.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to crouch behind the small plant, but his hat gave him away.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the trees seemed to crouch in fear.
meanings.sent5: In the game of hide-and-seek, I always crouch behind the curtains.

meanings.definition: A position where the body is bent low with the limbs close to the body.
meanings.sent1: Her crouch made it easy for her to hide in the bushes.
meanings.sent2: The baseball player's crouch helped him prepare for the pitch.
meanings.sent3: The tiny puppy's crouch was so adorable, it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's graceful crouch added elegance to her performance.
meanings.sent5: The ninja's silent crouch allowed him to move undetected.
